Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Sheila R
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 days in room 331 at the Hotel Gabrelli. We got the plane to Treviso, a bus to Venice and then Valporetta No 1 to Arsenal, 1 bridge and we were at the Hotel. We arrived early, went to see if we could drop our case off but were told that our room was ready and we could check in. Two bridges to San Marco, easy walking distance. We had a room over looking the bay, which gave us plenty of people watching to do if we were in the room. We went to reception and go our Free Internet access, although it does say on the card in the room that it is not free. bathroom was fine, Additional sink built into the wardrobe. Hotel staff were great, not that we really had much dealings with them everything was perfect. Breakfast was breakfast, no worse than many hotels I have stayed in, buffet style help yourself. It can be noisy when the valporetta are picking people up, dropping them off or being moored for the night, but we slept with the windows open, guess if you have walked enough during the day you can sleep through anything. I am not a good sleeper but managed fine. Overall a very pleasant stay in Venice

Reviews.Title: “If you like small rooms, this is the place”
Reviews.Author: Rockend86
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to our stay at the hotel, good location and from the description thought it was appealing. We were disappointed overall- the room was small, didn't look over the courtyard. We tried the restaurant for dinner and was very disappointed in the quality, quantity was satisfactory. If ordering wine, check to ensure you receive the wine is the year your ordered- will say no more on this. Breakfast was satisfactory. Front desk was friendly. Dining room service was inconsistent- breakfast -very good, dinner -not so good.

Reviews.Title: “Magic Location...and what a view!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hound72
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three magical nights here as part of our European honeymoon. When booking I mentioned it was our honeymoon and they put us in one of the most awesome rooms with views of the Grand Canal and the bustling strip of the Riva Delgi Schiavoni. We found the staff to be excellent with all our questions being answered in a helpful and friendly manner and they even booked a dinner and show for us at the Venice Jazz Club. I've read reviewers complaining about the breakfast but I can't see how you can complain when its included FREE in the room rate. That being said there is a selection of cereal, bacon, eggs, cold meats, cheeses, breads, sweet breakfast pastries, fruit, juice, coffee...so you should be ok!!! The location is fantastic as well being right in the heart of all the action and also the water taxi stop is right out the front of the hotel making getting anywhere in Venice really easy. We have decided that we want to come back to Venice again and would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “I am missing my tiny, comfy room overlooking the lagoon...”
Reviews.Author: RachelJean_123
Reviews.Content: The furniture was old, the decor was from another era as a previous reviewer said and I loved it! It was just what I hoped for for my first trip to the lovely Venice. My room was tiny and cosy and overlooked the lagoon. The bathroom was all marble and beautiful. Some of the staff may have seemed a little chilly but most were very kind and Caroline was one of the sweetest people I have met on my travels. I think she really made the visit for me. Every evening she was in the lobby when I returned from walking and exploring all day and she always was friendly and chatty. I left feeling like I had made a friend. I hope I will have many chances to return and I will always stay here! If you are looking for shiny, new, generic and all updated, this may not be the place for you. If you are looking for a charming place with lots of history in a beautiful location that has the character of the amazing city you have traveled to experience, come to the Hotel Gabrielli and hope that Caroline is in the front lobby waiting for you!

Reviews.Title: “Very Quaint & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: piglet0576
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our dream trip to Italy, visiting Venice, Florence & Rome in August of 2007. I realize this is a bit dated, but I meant to review earlier. After searching all the reviews and tips on Trip Advisor, I booked the Hotel Gabrielli for our stay in Venice. We were a little nervous having never been to Italy before, but were very happy once we arrived. A water taxi took us from the airport to almost directly in front of the hotel. The hotel is older and a bit small, but we loved the atmosphere and location. Check in was super easy, and our room looked directly over the water. Perfect views! The hotel offered breakfast in the indoor courtyard every morning. Everything was in immediate walking distance, St Marco Square, Rialto Bridge, museums, shopping, etc. We walked everywhere, so bring good walking shoes. One of our favorite moments was the gondola ride through the canals. Sounds cliche, but you have to do it! Absolutely loved Venice...it looks like a movie set straight out of Hollywood!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TOTHEALEX
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the experience, walking distance from the Saint Marco square - main attraction. The hotel looks nice and well-kept. However, our room faced the waterfront - which was very nice, but there was a hotel-related restaurant right underneath us - we could hear everything till late at night and woke up at 6 or 7 a.m. as the cleaning car was making a lot of noise downstairs. But we were on the 2nd floor, maybe a few floors up would be better - otherwise very nice hotel. Staff was helpful and gave us brown-bag breakfast as we were leaving early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: jeannetrips
Reviews.Content: I chose the Gabrielli for its location on the lagoon, just one bridge away from the water bus stop at Arsenale, for ease of transportation with luggage. While I have stayed at more elegant (and much more expensive) hotels in Venice, I thought it was a good value, very nice for an affordable price. We were delighted with our room looking out onto the Lagoon, agree with other reviewiers that the breakfast was excellent and the staff could not have been more helpful. Our room was spacious, immaculately clean and bright, with a beautiful bath and we loved the extra sink in a bedroom closet! At night the only noise was the peaceful sound of the water. I would definately recommend it to friends looking for a good value, good location.

Reviews.Title: “gr8 location , wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: MDoumit
Reviews.Content: i liked this hotel soo much. wonderful view.the stuff is helpful and the breakfast is delicous

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel Not a 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: richmoo1
Reviews.Content: Just finished a stay here. Worst hotel in Venice I have ever stayed at in 14 trips. A Most unfriendly and un-helpful desk staff. Hotel backs up to a commercial laundry and there is early morning and there is an all day noise of machines, carts, and people yelling. Rooms are Spartan boxes. Public spaces are dark and uninviting Resturant is way overpriced. Location is great but very few rooms face the canals. Most face walls or other rooms. I cant understand how this is a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “not worth 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: elsvw
Reviews.Content: As this was a last minute booking and supply of hotel rooms was at its minimum, we thought this hotel would be great to stay in, given it has 4 stars. This place is in dire need of a makeover, the rooms are old, tv set is from the 80's, bathroom wasn't crisp and the internet charges were outrageous. The only good thing about this hotel is its location but not worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Cracked ceilings, small uncomfortable bed and condescending staff- does NOT make up for the good location!”
Reviews.Author: WonderWomann
Reviews.Content: We had to book here as all our other choices were sold out and we did live to regret our experience here. The only possible good thing about this hotel is its location, near several vaparetto stops and right on the shoreline. (But the very same can be said of many other hotels right beside it, choose THEM!) But other than this every other experience at this run down and awfully expensive hotel was bad. The front desk staff (no smiles) was condescending and quite brisk, I did not know if this was because we are Asians or if they are like this in general. There was no free wi fi and the hotel had no complimentary internet points either- it was 2 Euros for the first 15 mins at their computer. With no other options you are forced to pay up. The entire hotel had a shabby, dusty and run down look about it. Now comes the room, cracks all over the walls and ceiling and barely space enough for 2 people to move, it was a disappointment for the outrageous rates they charged per night. The bed was so small that my husband (who is 6 feet) could not even stretch himself properly. It was 2 single beds joined together hence the middle parting made for an uneasy sleep; I fell out twice during the night when trying to turn over. The ancient AC did not work properly and we kept waking up to adjust the temperature as it was very hot in Venice in September. There was no tea/coffee ingredients in room which is not expected when you claim your hotel to be a 4 star. It most definitely was NOT. The breakfast was basic and breads were stale and old, as were the cheese. The toilet was adequate with a good shower but very dimly lit. The room came with a tiny balcony overlooking the canal which had a sideways view of the ocean- small but still it was nice to sit outside and people watch after sunset. To summarise, with this price there are several other hotels which can be a better deal and will have the same location- the hotelâ€™s sole selling point.

Reviews.Title: “I would go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: az72az
Reviews.Content: Small room, uncomfortable bed, unhelpful staff, average breakfast. The only good thing is location. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, could use some updating!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler90Canada
Reviews.Content: I travelled throughout Europe with a friend this past summer, and was surprised for my birthday with a night at Hotel Gabrielli Sandwirth. I have stayed at this Family's hotel in MÃ¶lln (Hotel Waldhof auf Herrenland) a few times (Which is now owned by one of their daughters - Francesca). Francesca has done extensive renovations on the Hotel in MÃ¶lln, and I must say, it used to be this old Italian/German style of hotel, and now its a majestic mix of old meets new. The right amount of character and old world charm, with comfortable and modern features. This is what their Hotel in Venice needs. The hotel in Venice is beautiful! Marbel floors as you walk in, old venician feel, beautiful courtyard that serves daily breakfast (with GREAT latte's!). The rooms are very old looking. I would say it does looks like they are trying to keep this old world feel, however it really isnt very appealing. As we were there, I was told the washrooms had all been redone these past few years. They were VERY VERY nice. Again marble, very clean and sophisticated look. If only the rest of the furniture was like this. The hotel restaraunt is also amazing! However from the outside you would never guess.. Their patio furniture is dingy and absolutely needs upgrading. I say let Francesca have a go at this hotel. If she can do what she did in MÃ¶lln, they would have a 6star hotel on their hands. It's in a great location, just a 5 minute walk to the main plaza, and shops, stores and restaraunts. The views from the hotel are amazing! Little secret is to head all the way to the top of the hotel and get a view of the fireworks from the roof top terrace. (Again could be made absolutely stunning with new furniture.) But is a great great view. I would absolutely recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: NorthEastShaz
Reviews.Content: Was a little unsure about travelling on my own to Venice but as it was only for 1 night took some advice and chose the hotel initially just for its position so did not know what to expect. Arriving a little hot and tired(felt a little underdressed in shorts) I was shown to my room by a porter even though I had no real luggage (explaining in Italian was interesting as he spoke no English though the reception staff did.) When he opened the curtain the view made it all worth while as the view summed up the best of Venice. As I was travelling on my own I had been expecting a pokey little room but it was a good size with very high ceilings which made it appear larger and the bed was huge. The rest of the furniture was limited but I didn't really need much and there was a sink in a "cupboard" as well as a decent sized bathroom. The room was quite warm but manageable. At night there was some noise from the boats nearby rocking in the water against their moorings but I still slept soundly (A day in Venice does that) Breakfast was in an internal garden which was very pleasant and there was a good choice though I was left to really find my way around. I forgot there was a roof terrace but the view from the view was enough. There is a water bus stop nearby and it is close to St Marks though after a long day it did seem further walking back. The staff were fairly formal but informative (rather than chatty friendly) . I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LJ76
Reviews.Content: My husband and i recently stayed at the Hotel Gabrielli for one night. It is located in a great spot and only takes a few minutes to walk to the main attractions of Venice. Staff were courteous and friendly on check-in and we were allocated a room on the 3rd floor - quite small but clean. The roof top garden of the hotel is amazing and we were able to watch the sun setting over Venice whilst enjoying a few pre-dinner drinks - this is definitely the best thing about the hotel. There is also a ground floor garden located at the rear of the hotel which provides a peaceful area if you are seeking some chill-out time away from the hussle and bussle of Venice. Breakfast the following morning was pleasant - a wide selection of cereals, breads, cheeses etc. and fresh juices/coffee. A nice place to stay if you are seeking a central location in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “I was expecting a bit more”
Reviews.Author: RibeiroNeto
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, small elevator, restaurant that closes at 10:00pm, no 24/7 room service, but a good location and nice staff. A classic European three stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well sited excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: KMICHAEL
Reviews.Content: Well siuated overlooking the Grand Basin we did not have a view over the water but internally over a fantastic breakfast patio/garden. The room was smaller than average but had plenty of storage and a good bathroom. Make time to sit in the roof garden and watch the boats and breathe in the view!!! Breakfast was excellent with plenty of continental breakfast and we were able to sit in the internal paio/garden and soak up thew weather. Overall can't think of anything wrong (although being English I had to bring my own tea!!)

Reviews.Title: “Very charming, great for couples”
Reviews.Author: Eirhnh_77
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend treated me to a weekend in Venice at this hotel and I loved every minute of it. We had a room overlooking the lagoon- the room had an old school charm, was very spacious and clean, The breakfast was nicely done and the little courtyard was a delightful bonus. The history of the place is extremely interesting aswell- the hotel has been run by the same family for centuries (they are originally from Austria). Strongly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: gsbchitown
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Gabrielli Sandwirth is in a great location -- on the water and a little ways past the Bridge of Sighs. It was not as crowded with tourist trappings as closer to Piazza San Marco, and was a little quieter, but still close to all main attractions. The room was clean and comfortable, and the air conditioning worked great. The bathroom was a pretty good size (by European standards!), although the shower was a little odd (the taps were located over the toilet, outside the shower stall!) and the shower did not drain well. The breakfast included with the room was great -- bread, sweet rolls, jam, eggs, bacon, coffee and juice, and was served in a charming outside courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location but tiny rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: wandering-thots
Reviews.Content: The best location one can ask for a few minutes walk from San Marco. A few steps from the Vaporetto (Water Bus stop). Easy to get to and from the station (Santa Lucia) take the boat line #1 from inside the city seeing all the sights that takes about 45 mins or take line #42 from the station that takes the outside route and reaches in about 25 mins, get off at Arsanale and walk to the hotel which is not more than 5-7 mins!!! Do not forget to pack light because no one is going to help you drag your heavy strollers on the cobbled streets of Venice and over many bridges!! Hotel has the best location on the lagoon! ask for a room over looking the lagoon which was missed out in my booking! I had a tiny prison cell like room where i could hardly move around in with my bag! however that made the room more cosy & the sleep quality amazing. But the rooms and the hotel deffy needs some serious renovation. I was never informed about the gardens or the roof top bars, i wonder why!? That would have been a very relaxing way to spend the evening had someone told me! The restaurants outside the hotel entrance serve some of the most delicious pizzas, pastas & tiramisus! Must try specially in the evening when the lagoon is lit up beautifully, looks magical! The breakfast is very basic and does not offer a lot of options so do not expect much from it! Carry lots of water to the room because i did not find any traces of a minibar or water in the room. Which deffy saved me some money! Water can be bought from the vendors on the street along the water.. Bathroom was deffy a disaster and needs the most serious renovation with a stinky plastic curtain separating the super tiny shower with the rest of the bathroom. The sheer curtain does not stop any water from messing up the entire bathroom. the shower head needs to be changed as the water jetting out is so piercing that i worried at times that i might have to see a doctor for serious injuries and also became very careful to avoid the water hitting my face and eyes! overall the stay was comfortable except for the bathroom problems! must stay and experience the splendors of the old Venetian Pallazo living. Also do not forget yourself the Venice pass which can be purchased at most of the Boat stations which allows you to enter most of the sites, museums, pallazos, discounts on boat journeys etc. and while in Venice take the boat trip to Murano, Burano & Torcello.

Reviews.Title: “DOES THE JOB”
Reviews.Author: StaffordshireJulie
Reviews.Content: we stayed here from 28 April -1st May 2011.The hotel is very very old and quite dark.It is very clean throughout ,but very much in need of a facelift.The rooms at the front are spacious and have fantastic views of the lagoon.Breakfast was just ok not much choice and the croissants were stale on one of the mornings and there is no orange juice just pineapple and grapefruit , we also found it strange that there is an outside area at the front but you were not allowed to eat breakfast there.The staff were very helpful and not stern as written in previous reviews.I stayed in another hotel very near to this one last year and i felt it was much better and more modern but if you like history and very old buildings then this is the one for you .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and quiet. Ideal for 3 of us.”
Reviews.Author: ColliEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in April. We got there by car, parking in Fusina, getting a ferry to Zaccheria then a ferry bus from there to San Marco, which is right next to the hotel. It is in a great spot, near Saint Marks Square with all the hussle and bustle, but also close to the quiet side of town with the Castillo. On reflection it is best to be away from the water because of the noise of motor boats. We were in a quiet room to the side of the building with a double bed and single. Cost Â£520 total for 2 nights including breakfast for the 3 of us. The hotel was quirky, but we liked this. It had wifi - 2 hrs for 5 Euros but you had to be in the TV room to get it. The bathroom had a bidet right opposite the toilet, which was a bit disconcerting, but the room was very clean. It was very hot and the air con was rubbish, but we had shutters so closed them and kept the windows open. Breakfast had lots of choice including scrambled eggs and bacon, although not necessary all to the British taste ie. cake, cheese etc. All in all a lovely hotel with a nice feel to it. My only criticism would be that it didn't advertise its dinner menu in the rooms and it wasn't very attractive so we ate elsewhere. Possibly could do with making it a feature to keep guests there to eat and drink. Oh, almost forgot... the hotel has the most amazing roof terrace overlooking the whole bay. You can order down to the bar for drinks and stay up there until 11pm watching the sun set and the lights and boats on the grand canal.. Be warned before you go...it is very expensive in Venice. We had two rounds of drinks and 2 bowls of chips costing 49 Euros!!!!! Other tourists were questioning bills in restaurants as they were very steep. For a treat, try a drink called 'Spritz', a Venetian aperetif drink which is absolutely gorgeous. Another tip. Buy a water bus ticket once costing 6.5 Euros and then use it for free on all trips as no-one checks it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value, Friendly staff. Couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: Brianboxer
Reviews.Content: We arrived late and went straight to lounge where we ordered a bottle of Red which arrived with a bowl of nibbles. This was much appreciated as there was nothing else to eat until breakfast. My only moan about the hotel was there were no tea/coffee facility in the bedroom. Breakfast was OK and was served between 07.30 and 10.30 which allowed a lie in if needed. The staff were all friendly and welcoming. We used the restaurant one night for dinner which was excellent. There was no wi-fi but there was a PC in a room off reception if desperate to make a connection. Our room had a safe for storing valuables at no extra charge. Having got the room at a bargain price we expected no view but were pleasantly surprised to be overlooking the side and front waterways from our "Romeo and Juliet" balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but please renovate”
Reviews.Author: johnwallis
Reviews.Content: We were there with my wife during the Venice festival. Rooms are OK but they would definitely need some updating, they are probably dated 70's, which leaves you in a strange atmosphere and the bed would definitely enjoy a new mattress ! Breakfast was nothing special. It's probably a great location for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Gabrielli Sandwirth”
Reviews.Author: jmac1945
Reviews.Content: One bridge from Arsenale vaporetto stop - easy to find. Three bridges from Piazza San Marco. Large room, comfortable bed, good bathroom, good breakfast, lovely courtyard, lovely roof garden (Campari orange at sunset), staff friendly and helpful.. Good value and I would (will) stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug bites”
Reviews.Author: s33ma
Reviews.Content: During the August bank holiday, we had a standard room. With the old furniture we had woke up with bites over arms and face. Not very nice. Room was small, Bed and pillow very firm making sleep very uncomfortable. staff were helpful but didn't find them too welcoming. They only spoke to you when approached. Overall a decent hotel for a one or two nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “make sure you eat in! savour the rich history of the place.”
Reviews.Author: geoffpsych
Reviews.Content: Third time in Venice. Have stayed at the Grand Canal, the Canaletto and Gabrielli. Which one would I come back to? The Gabrielli without a doubt. The history and charm of the place typifies venetian grandeur in a classic way. The furniture and fittings are of a bygone era, just look at the chairs in the bar downstairs. Make sure you eat in the first night - because then you will have the chance to savour all the exceptional dishes mad ein the hotel - second to none - and I mean it. The fish is served after the head waiter fillets and debones it at the table! The director walking through the dining room chatting with the guests is an opportunity to hear stories linked with the fabulous history of the hotel. A bath in the bathroom is a rarity these days but easily avilable in this gem of a hotel. The decorated ceilings, high quality marble and general atmosphere os the hotel will certainly appeal to the discerning visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you”
Reviews.Author: helsv
Reviews.Content: We were at the 'Gabrielli Sandwirth' and were very satisfied. 'Gabrielli Sandwirth' is a very agreable Hotel with a very friendly staff. We recommand it to all, who prefere an agreable athmosphere! Sven and Franziska Hellman, Berne, Switzerland

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & a rooftop garden!”
Reviews.Author: PFitzDC
Reviews.Content: Small room, no frills, facing an internal courtyard--but clean, neat, comfortable bed and the basic furnishings for a short stay. The location can't be beat--right at the entrance to the Grand Canal, steps from several vaporetto stops and mere blocks from Piazza San Marco. A courtyard garden was lovely--if I had more time, or this was a repeat trip to Venice, I would have sat there for an hour or so to take in the serenity. The rooftop garden was sublime. Great views---one evening I sat for several hours writing postcards and reading, just listening to the sounds of the boats on the water. The staff were not "friendly" by some American standards, but very helpful and professional. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: Bedfordcouple002
Reviews.Content: This was built as a grand hotel and it still retains great charm. Staff were attentive, courteous and professional. Hotel shows its age but still manages to be clean, cool and comfortable with echoes of its former grandeur. Breakfast is a plentiful continental buffet; we loved the open courtyard with its cheeky sparrows eyeing the crumbs of your croissant. Ideal location on the only seafront promenade in town and a roof terrace with views to die for. Warm evenings watching the water traffic and the light changing over the pastel city. Wonderful holiday, beautiful city, lovely hotel to come home to. Wonderfully conveniently located 300 metres from Arsenale boat stop, making it ideal for transfers to Marco Polo Airport and for getting to all the sights of the city.

Reviews.Title: “very goood hotel”
Reviews.Author: pkumar85
Reviews.Content: an amazing hotel with a good location and good service and very good hospitality..!!1 they upgraded me to a canal view hotel free of charge!!

Reviews.Title: “Lake Views”
Reviews.Author: AbhishekG_Mumbai
Reviews.Content: Hotel very romantic, ideal for a short stay in the city of domes. Notre room was perfectly located on the first floor. Spacious, quiet (exceptional in Venice) overlooking a courtyard, arranged in accordance to the style of the place ie the old, but everything was in joint air bathroom and dressing room. The staff were unfailingly friendly, helpful and professional. beautiful roof terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but do your homework.”
Reviews.Author: ScottishRichard
Reviews.Content: Well let's start with location, location ,location. This hotel has a superb location just along the waterfront between St Marks and the Arsenale. Wonderful views and just enough bridges from St Marks to avoid the really massive crowds. Rooms; read the reports! Some are tiny (this is an old building) or on the interior which , bizarrely is built round the hotel office. About 6 and only 6 of the rooms are along the front, spacious with wonderful views from the balcony. Phone, E mail etc and request the best rooms! Ours was spacious, very comfy bed, excellent bathroom; we felt like the Doge while others in tiny rooms on the top floor felt like..well you know whats next. Amazingly during our stay (very late season perhaps?) , service was great, breakfast OK (and OK is a very high mark for food in Venice which is a tourist sausage machine). We took advantage of the free motor boat taxi to Burano in return for looking at the glass factory. We are such peasants that we had never been on one of these varnished beauties before, only on the vaporetto. Little bit of a wobble at bill time but soon sorted and we will be back this September with all my in-laws...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Soujourner69
Reviews.Content: The Gabrielli Sandwirth turned out to be a great, traditional lodging located *inside* of Venice proper. Our rooms were old-fashioned, but always clean; same thing for the bathroom. The staff was friendly and helpful on every occasion. The breakfast options weren't that big though - but then we're not exactly 'breakfast people'.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky place, ultra traditional, with good and bad parts”
Reviews.Author: MichaelH62
Reviews.Content: Not cheap, and very old fashioned, with the owner (matriarchal figure) on parade in the foyer. Reception and Concierge staff extremely curt to the pouint of rudeness; bad fisr impressions. Rooms small but clean, and very, very olde worlde. Nice courtyard breakfasts served by pleasnt staff, and the rooftop "garden" and the quiet garden to the rear make up for other deficits. Would recommend with provisos.

Reviews.Title: “The charm may just grow on you”
Reviews.Author: aussie1961
Reviews.Content: OK, so first impressions may disappoint. The rooms are nowhere near as glamorous as the hotel website may suggest. They are small, the beds are very firm (which is OK by me) and the bathrooms are cramped and strangely configured. The furniture is mostly old (not antique) and a "double" means two single beds pushed together with a 6" gap in between. Cleanliness is confusing to comment on. The Frette bedlinen (and it is actually linen) and towels are immaculate as are the bathrooms, but you may find a squashed bug or two on the curtains or lampshades. Now if you can look past that, you will find a charming hotel in an excellent position, run by equally charming, elderly hosts who take a personal interest in their guests. Not too far from St Marks, but far enough away to avoid the crowds and noise if you need to. The breakfast, which is included in the room rate, is a selection of very sweet croissants, sweetened fruit salad, yogurt and various cheeses and cured meats. Good, just very sweet. The bar, which was renovated in the 50's, is a pink marble gem serviced by white jacketed waiters. The owners indicated a renovation was imminent during their annual closure this year. I hope they realise the kitsch potential and don't touch that bar! It's the real deal. If you stay here, organise a water taxi from the rear entrance to make your departure to the airport just that bit more glamorous. Wave goodbye to your friendly hosts then ride through the canals in a beautiful timber speedboat out to the lagoon and recall that the Gabrielli's faded charm is actually very charming.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyJustme
Reviews.Content: Don't let the 4 star rating fool you. The location is excellent and the staff pleasant but thats all it has going for it. The rooms were very old had mould on the walls and a pecular smell, The bathroom was tiny and inconvenient and the faucets to control the shower were located above the toilet + the bed was extremely uncomfortable. This hotel should be rated more like a 2-3star.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: AmoMondo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay in this hotel with my 15 year old niece. the location was superb - not far to walk to Piazza San Maroc and there were loads of great restaurants within walking distance either on the lagoon front (avoid the tourist ones as they are overpriced and the food substandard) or in quite little side streets. Breakfast is included and we particularly liked that it was available in the little garden cortyrad in the centre of the hotel. it was delightful to eat out in the open air and listen to the birds singing in the trees. We also liked the roof top sun terrace which not only gave fantastic views accross the lagoon and city but was a great sun trap. We also liked the decor and antique furniture everywhere. The terrace outside the bar was a great place to have a drink in the evening and gaze out over the lagoon or to San marco. The bar prices are steep but then so is everything in Venice. Our room was a bit small and had a courtyard view, however as we had gotten a bargain rate, i wasn't expecting a superior room with a lagoon view. We both liked this hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again. If you are going there, the nearest vaparetto step is Aresenal and is less than 5 minutes walk although you do have a bridge to cross. The alilaguna rosso airport water bus stops there as do many other vaparetti.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable hotel and good base for the sights”
Reviews.Author: catecate
Reviews.Content: Arriving by private taxi started the stay in style. We chose this hotel as it was used in the Dudley Moore film Blame it on the Bell Boy - which I love. This was my third trip to Venice and having previously had drinks in the gorgeous courtyard garden I wanted to stay here. If arriving by water bus/vaporetto you have a short walk from the nearest stop to the front of the hotel. If arriving by private water taxi you arrive down a side canal and have to get off, up some steps and ring the bell on an old dark door. Thankfully the boat driver waited as we'd have been stranded if no one had answered the door. It really added to the aura of old Venice arriving by the back door! We were greeted by a very friendly and helpful porter. It has an antiquated charm about it. It isn't flash and the room was pretty basic but I loved flinging open the shutters and hearing the bells ringing across the city in the morning and evening. The staff were helpful, and the bar man has been there many many years - and enjoyed talking about when the filming took place there. The garden was lovely but as it was March we weren't able to sit and wile away the hours in there - which in the summer is such a treat as a haven from the general hustle and bustle of Venice. Breakfast was very basic and I didn't like having to walk through the dining room to get to our room. The clientale is generally around 50-60yrs old, so it is a quieter hotel so those looking for a lively place should give this place a miss. However, it is a great base for exploring Venice being a 10min walk to St Mark's square.

Reviews.Title: “Failed to Book a Taxi”
Reviews.Author: rnp91324
Reviews.Content: When I checked in to the Gabrielli Sandwirth, I informed the concierge that I needed to take a 7:00 a.m. flight the following morning out of Marco Polo Airport. He assured me that he would book a 5:30 a.m. taxi for me, and would have coffee and an early breakfast ready. The next morning, I had to wake the man at the desk, who knew nothing about a taxi and didn't seem concerned about finding a solution to my problem. Fortunately, I found a lone water taxi at 5:40, and barely made my flight. The Gabrielli Sandwirth was clean, quiet, and elegant in an old fashioned way. However, it is a long walk from many of the major attractions in Venice, except for Piazza San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Just for the location”
Reviews.Author: kiroro
Reviews.Content: Good Points: -Very easy to find in the most complicated town, very easy acess as it says on the website -The hotel is located in the busiest street in the island, so even if you are a girl traveling alone, you won't find it unsafe to stay out late at night. (especially when the summer time when the daytime is longer) -There is a roof garden, which can overlook some nice view, very relaxing Bad points -Too overpriced, but then all the hotels are rediculously expensive in major Italian cities, so I guess it cannot be avoided -Good for a traveler with limited time because of its easy access and close location to all major attractions, but if you have time, there should be better place with cheaper price...

Reviews.Title: “very traditional and lovely”
Reviews.Author: lolly30
Reviews.Content: before i booked this hotel i did look at the reviews on here and i have to say, how misleading, and tgrossly exaggerated! admittedly, the place was traditional and old but it had character! the staff were great, the rooms were cleaned and bedsheets and towels were changed everyday and i have to say i was impressed. everyone was friendly, genuinely and not just because they had to be. the cleaners were very friendly and not just cleaning for the sake of it! all in all a fabulous short break hotel that is in close proximety to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, no frills hotel.”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinBadger
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently spent 8 days in Italy, of that we were in Venice for one night. Since we were not going to be in town too long, we decided that we didn't need to spend a fortune on a hotel. I have to admit that based on some of the reviews that I read about this hotel before we left, I was pretty nervous about it. Here's a realistic, honest review of the hotel... 1. This hotel is easy to get to. We followed the suggestions on the hotel's website to find our way there. Santa Lucia train station to vaporetto #1 (the slower one that lets you take in a good view of the Grand Canal), we exited at the Arsenale stop. As the website suggested, this took about 40 minutes or so. The hotel is located very close to this vaporetto stop. This is one reason I would recommend someone stay here. Of the 3-4 cities we went to in Italy, Venice definitely appeared to be the one where it was ok to be openly lost. You always read in travel guides things like "look at your map discreetly..."- not in Venice. We had large backpacks & I would have gotten tired of weaving in & out of the Venice streets trying to track down my hotel. If you want something that's easy to find, consider this hotel. It's a very convenient walk to Piazza San Marco. Overall location is the key when it comes to this hotel. 2. Age of hotel- The "this place is old & not in a good way" comment that I read before I left freaked me out. Yes, it's an older hotel but in a way you get what you pay for. Sure a new bedspread might spruce the place up a bit & the bed was kind of hard but overall there's really nothing wrong outwardly wrong with the hotel. I admit that when we first got there & in to our rooms I was a little weirded out but after some time I settled down. Again, for a night or two I think you'll be just fine. 3. Breakfast- I'd read that the hotel breakfasts in Venice were pretty low key. I would agree. It was nice to have a little something to eat in the morning, but don't expect anything too big. There were only two issues that kind of gave me a negative feeling about this hotel. Once during our stay we stopped in to grab something from our room on our way out of the hotel we walked past the concierge's desk. He left his post for a minute to go talk to someone. There, sitting on his desk, was someone's Mexican passport. Now when you check in to this hotel they ask you to leave ID (rather than just photocopying your passport like some of the other hotels we stayed at did). We didn't really want to give up our passports so we just gave them our driver's licenses. Now that had my passport sitting unattended I would have been furious. It would have been easy enough for someone to swipe it. This certainly could have been an isolated incident- but it wasn't good. I was also was a little thrown off when we asked if we could store our luggage with them for an afternoon before we left town. They said yes & directed us to a separate room where they keep luggage. There's no door, no lock, it's just a little alcove where you can leave your luggage. Again, I'm sure that overall they keep an eye on who is going in that area but it was not really as secure as I would have liked it. My husband reassured me that there was a room full of luggage & it would be fine. All in all if you'd like to spend your time & money exploring Venice not just sitting in your hotel room then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE! Don't let the pictures fool you!”
Reviews.Author: pontyUsa
Reviews.Content: We just came back from this place and let me tell you it was a nightmare!! My boyfriend was fooled by all the fancy pictures and the 4 star rating, when we arrived it was a tiny old not old fashioned but OLD from the 1920s furniture, literally! Even the mirrors were so old, you coudn't even see yourself in it, I'm sure it was a 4 star hotel in 1920 because the room we stayed in was not updated at ALL!!! Old, warped, worn out furniture, bathroom it was a relic and not clean at all. The bed, both twins were completely sunk in the middle, the breakfast was sooo mediocre, one of the plainest, bland, cheap quality breakfasts in europe! DO NOT STAY here, the concierge was useless and the staff were unfriendly, you will get NO service here, we spent more money looking for decent restaurants. The ONLY thing that was good was the location, close to San Marco but really we didn't even want to go back to the hotel!! Go to Metropole Hotel, its well worth the money and the experience!!! Oh and the intenet costs 6 euros for 30 min!!! and the computer at the office has a charge as well! ridiculous!!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: JohannaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gabrielli Sandwirth was recommended highly by my travel agent. However, I was apprehensive because of the many negative opinions on this site. I have recently spent ten nights at this hotel. The location could not be better : overlooking the Venice Lagoon and just a few minutes walk to Piazza San Marco, Basilica San Marco and the Doges Palace. The staff are first rate. They are professional, very competent and obliging. The complimentary breakfast, wether in the restaurant or your room, is excellent. The restaurant, too, is very good. The emphasis in the restaurant is on local and seasonal produce. My room was small but the cleanest hotel room I have stayed in in many years of travelling. The bed linen IS LINEN. No polyester here. The hotel has a garden, two courtyards and a rooftop terrace with a delightful view. Each of these areas is serviced, as is the cafe/bar out the front. The hotel may be a little faded but it is a fourteenth century palazzo. You would not stay here if contemporary hotels are your preference. The hotel has its own warf. My arrival and departure by water taxi is a unique Venice experience wich added to the enjoyment of my stay. If it were not so far from Australia to Venice, I would return immediately.

Reviews.Title: “old-fashioned and not in a good way”
Reviews.Author: Mollydolly03
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the pretty pictures of the rooms and surroundings on the website and also because it was 4 stars. The 4 stars looked like they were awarded 30 years ago and no one had got round to removing them. When you walk in, it is all very faded grandeur. Reception is handsome (beautiful floors and ceilings) although the bar looks like it was added in a fit of bad taste in the peachy 80s. The breakfast area opens into a little courtyard where you will spend the entire meal swatting away sparrows, unless you like the idea of these incontinent flying mice pecking at your food. Breakfast is minimal but fine if you enjoy strong coffee and croissants. The first room we were taken to was very small and all the furnture was G-Planesque but not as nice, with an attractive orangy/yellow nylon counterpane on the sagging bed. The bathroom was decorated with mushroom tiles and the TV in the room was exceptionally compact. The window overlooked a wall. I went back to reception and asked if there was another room available. The receptionist rolled his eyes at me and said 'like what?' I replied, 'like a room that resembles the ones on the website?'. I duly was shown a room 4 times the size of the previous one, with a superking bed, a chaise longue, a bigger-albeit shiny poo brown cracked tiled- bathroom and an overview of the afore mentioned sparrow infested courtyard. It was much better and air conditioned although still elderly and past it's day. On the plus side, there was a terrace that overlooks the water (although you have to go down 4 flights to the bar if you want to order anything) and the concierge service was very good. Food in Venice is more expensive than the posh end of London, but, on the whole very nice. We went to a recommended fish restaurant and had the tasting menu which was gorgeous and on the second night, we ate at the Barbican, a tiny 800 year old pub, which was beautiful. On our last day, we went to a deli round the corner from the hotel and had paninis made up for a packed lunch which we ate by the shore of Lake Garda. I adored Venice and can particularly recommend the Peggy Gugenheim. If you really want a good 4 star hotel, save up and stay at the Metropole. Staggeringly cheap was the train ride over the lagoon- 2 euros return!

Reviews.Title: “what a find”
Reviews.Author: anniebelleSuffolk
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for two nights prior to a cruise,the hotel is a real gem,an amazing view over the lagoon from our room at the front, with a terrace on the roof where you can rest your weary feet after walking around venice, we had breakfast at the hotel,good selection continental breakfast, meals in venice are obviously expensive dependin on the location of the restaurant,but there are cheaper places to eat if you go away from the main tourist spots. we would certainly return here if we go back to venice.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Bad Bad !!!”
Reviews.Author: Paiam
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in April. I chose this hotel fascinated of its website but really don't believe it . The only positive things of this hotel are: 1. Its location is great. 5 min. or less to Piazza San Marco and it is on the sea so if you are lucky (and pay more) and you have the view on the sea it's really nice 2. Its restaurant and entrance decorations . It's a typical old venecian palace so great decrationa on the walls and roof (i'm talking of course about the main floor, reception, hall and restaurants area) 3. The breakfast is good and enough but here is coming the ther aspects: 1. really RUDE receptionists . i've seen 3 of them and all were so snob . it seemed i should PRAY them to look at my face and answer . I think they have forgotten what smiling to a customer is. 2. i'd reserved a single room ... oh my god it was a hole ! really ... there was a small bed (god thanks i am just 170cm) , a small table to put the baggage and a really small mini wardrobe . The bathroom was really funny, i practiced many yoga and stretching movements to stay in the bathroom ... Men we are talking about a four stars hotel not a hostel !!! 3. Well ... when you book a 4 star hotel , ok the room can be small but i expect some facilities in the room ... maybe a TV? maybe a refregerator? No !! nothing 4. i tried the room but the snob-frontdesker says they were full all the days. Maybe they culd be more helpful 5. The room was clean but from a 4star hotel i expect something special, maybe a good soap, a good shampoo , extra towels ? NO ! so ... i'm sorry but for my personal experience, my suggestion is ... in Venice there are many hotels !! maybe cheaper but with a better quality ! at least ... in cheaper hotels you say i've paid less so some less-services could be accepted but in a 4star hotel no!

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a room on the highest floor you can get.”
Reviews.Author: GFG
Reviews.Content: I was worried about some of the more negative reviews about the hotel, especially as I am a light sleeper and didn't want to pay the upgrade to a lagoon view. Fortunately, we got put in room 501 which although at the back of the hotel was on the fifth floor and had a wonderful roof top view complete with glimpse of the Campanile from the bathroom and the lagoon if you stuck your head out of the window! The noise from alleys below does resonate up into the buildings but this is to be expected and happened at another hotel I stayed in last time in Venice so now I always travel with ear plugs! The hotel staff were friendly enough, the breakfast quite comprehensive, decor typically Venetian and the position of the hotel is ideal. If you stay here check out the roof terrace too, very lovely at sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: eastmoor
Reviews.Content: The location is the main attraction, being a short walk from St Markâ€™s Square and 100m from the water bus stop which led right up the Grand Canal. The views over the lagoon are fantastic. The staff are generally very friendly and helpful. Nothing about this hotel warrants 4 stars. It is tired and jaded. The rooms need a complete refurbishment; they are tatty, small and soulless. The heating was oppressive and there didnâ€™t seem to be any air conditioning. The buffet breakfast is boring and unimaginative and never changes. Being on the lagoon front, noise from the constant to and fro of boats and ferries is very disruptive, particularly in the morning. When we tried to book some trips we were given a brochure for a company that was not open during our stay (their opening dates were clearly displayed in the brochure). All in all, itâ€™s totally over priced for what it delivers. There must be better hotels in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mistyblue110
Reviews.Content: Okay, so the hotel could do with a refurb, but what a great location! Our room overlooked the Lagoon and we had the most fantastic views - archytpal Venice was just outside our windows and St Mark's was maybe 50-100ms away. Don't let the attitude of the staff put you off this hotel. From an initial frostiness to beaming smiles and chat - that was our experience of checking in. Don't be put off by the surliness. Yes the first impressions of the staff aren't good, but as our stay went on they became more pleasant. If you are nice to people they tend to respond in kind. We would go back to the hotel in an instant: it was very reasonably priced; very easy to get to from the airport; perfectly situated to explore the sights and the breakfasts were enough to keep us going all day!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: MsPeggy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location....you don't have to lug heavy bags very far once off water ferry. And there are ramps on and off water bus and over most main bridges in Venice. Anyway, the hotel was old of course. i thought the common areas were cozy and elegant. Old, not so much rundown. my room was small and had the bare essentials. there's lots of room for storing clothes but the room is tiny and bare. Our room was off a small courtyard and the windows opened onto it. Outside of the room, the hotel was quaint. The hotel is quite large with many rooms. We didn't need the room with the view since we had the rooftop. That's a plus. One thing i didn't like was THEY LOCK YOU OUT OR IN, DEPENDS HOW YOU LOOK AT IT...AT MIDNITE. they pull this huge gate over the entrance and you have to stand there and ring the bell for what seems like eternity before someone comes, ANNOYED to let you in. meanwhile i had to go to the bathroom because there's none around especially after midnite. I don't know if its the graffiti they are worried about or what but i want to be able to enter my hotel at 2 AM. not stand outside for even 2 minutes!! Some hotels have a buzzer systems or a card key to open the door. But this huge gate?? Other then that I liked the hotel and wasn't bothered by the courtyard noise. There was heat (no choice for A/C if you're one who's always warm or like white noise) and they provided nice white down comforters because it was getting cold. Everything was lovely! Tip: DON'T BE CHEAP LIKE US....get the venice map for 3 Euros at the train station on arrival and you won't be running around like a lunatic looking for streets and wasting hours trying to find a restaurant etc. The hotel provides a map, it's not great, get the map that cost 3 euro. ; )

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but worth it!”
Reviews.Author: summers_slayer
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Gabrielli Sandwirth for 4 nights in June as a last minute impulse holiday and we were not disappointed. There seems to be a common theme among the reviews in that majority of the rooms are very small, however we did pay that bit extra for a deluxe room. It was very expensive at Â£1k for the 4 nights, but certainly worth it! The huge room was on the top floor of the hotel with 2 windows over looking the lagoon (see pics uploaded) so it was lovely and bright (with wooden shutters that could be pulled down if the sun was too bright for you). It had a king size bed (2 singles bolted together) 2 wardrobes, a dresser and stool, safe, a table and 2 chairs and our own temperature controller. The sunken bathroom was also gorgeous! Completely spotless like the bedroom, with 2 sinks, a large bath, shower, toilet, bidet, coat stand and shelves. As our room was front facing there was quite a bit of noise in the morning and evenings with the Vaporetto's and taxi's docking and banging against each other, but you will get this with any hotel you book along the water front and it actually added to the charm for us. Surprisingly as well the stocked mini bar in the room was about the same price as the bar if not cheaper as we were well chuffed by how small the bill was on check out. The continental breakfast in the hotel is pretty standard with a bowl of what looks like tinned fruit salad, fruit juice, great coffee, pastries, eggs and cold meats. You can have your breakfast either in the little restaurant which oddly also serves as the corridor to the elevator, so I would personally sit outside in the little garden. Tip: If you are having a drink late at the hotel, you can only sit out the front until midnight, but you can ask the barman if you can sit in the garden later if you like. Order the Venetian drink Spritz at your preference of sweet or bitter. Another benefit of this hotel is the rooftop terrace. You can sit here after a busy days shopping and sight seeing and enjoy the view over Venice and order a drink from the bar where you will also be brought some olives and peanuts. The hotel itself is the perfect location for anyone's 1st visit to Venice. 5 minutes walk away from St. Marks Square, a 1 minute walk from a variety of restaurants and 50 yards from Arsenale Vaporetto stop and AliLaguna stop, perfect for anyone travelling from the airport, so you do not need to drag your bags for miles. All the staff we had dealings with were friendly and polite enough. The concierge is very knowledgeable so take advantage of that and ask him where to go, how to get there etc... He booked a walking tour and a boat tour for us. A couple of the receptionists are a bit abrupt, but we did not have much dealings with them anyway. I would highly recommend this hotel, but I would say pay the extra for a better room! I saw a small room when housekeeping had left the door wide open and it was dreary with 2 single beds crushed in with only about 2 feet of walking space and 1 window.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the web site”
Reviews.Author: Carringt0n
Reviews.Content: If my stay at this hotel taught me anything it was not to trust Hotel web sites in future. It is promoted as elegant and stylish, with plenty of amazing photos which were obviuosly taken several years ago. It is, in fact, dark, drab and dated with most of the elegant furniture removed. We were made to feel most unwelcome throughout our stay and never encountered a single friendly member of staff. Several attempts for advice on travel and booking taxis were met with unhelpful replies and we were very much left to make our own arrangements. The only positive for this hotel is its position, but don't be enticed by this, there are plenty of other less expensive hotels a bit further back, where you can just as easily reach the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Give this place a miss if you are a woman travelling on your own”
Reviews.Author: Deborah015
Reviews.Content: While some staff were polite and helpful, others did quite a good job of combining being quite rude with fairly overt attempts to stare down the front of my dress. Needless to say I ate out for most of my visit. One would have hoped that staff at a 4 star hotel would have good enough training to show people from all cultures and backgrounds basic levels of respect and courtesy.

Reviews.Title: “Try the Gabrielli Sandwirth”
Reviews.Author: RTK1316
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for four days in May 2007. We found it online and booked it through an online agency because it offered a fourth night free, which made it fairly reasonable (for Venice, anyway). The hotel sits right on the main canal and we could have upgraded to a room with a view, but we didn't. The location couldn't be much better. The hotel sits right on the Grand Canal just a few blocks down from the Doge's Palace and just a few steps from either the San Zaccharia or the Arsenale vaporetto (water bus) stations. It's an old palace, and while our room was small, it was clean and comfortable. We enjoyed taking our breakfasts (which were standard European breads and cheeses) in a little interior garden. You don't need to spend extra for a room with a view because the hotel has a wonderful rooftop garden that offers terrific views of the canal and the Riva Degli Schiavoni (the canalside promenade). A special treat is to be there to watch one of the mammoth cruise ships entering or leaving the canal. We would stay thre again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A Waterside Gem”
Reviews.Author: gum57
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this waterside gem. We upgraded to a lagoon view (room 325, a corner room) where we could watch all the water activity from our bed. Do this before you arrive! Fabulous view. Our children were two doors down on the side, but they had a spectacular view from their balcony. (We did not upgrade them) The beds are hard, but they didn't interrupt my sleep. The rooms are charming with their own little quirks. Open a door expecting a closet and you might find another sink with perfect lighting for doing your make-up while your husband is steaming up the bathroom.Wonderful little courtyard for breakfast where we could plot our walk for the day. There is afternoon sunbathing with cool drinks on the roof terrace which has a spectacular view; or after dinner drinks on the sidewalk from Santi, the bartender. Santi has all the personality in the hotel. (We did not have dinner at the hotel) There is also a lovely shaded garden in the back for a quiet swing while reading a book. Convenient to all the boats, water taxis, gondolas, alilagunas you could want, the hotel is a two minute walk to St Marks. In the late afternoon, you can have a drink at one of the cafes in the square and enjoy the war of the bands. Splurge and enjoy a water taxi tour with a bottle of wine. A great way to enjoy the charm of the city! Of course there are always the gondola rides as well! We took a boat from in front of the hotel to Lido for a day at the beach. From the airport, you can take the Alilaguna Rose to Arsenale which is right in front of the hotel. If there are four or more of you, I would recommend tossing in a few extra euros for a private water taxi. (Between 90 and 100 euros) Beautiful boats! Ask him to go down the grand canal. It will set the tone for your whole stay! When we departed a water taxi picked us up from the side entrance of the hotel where Vladimir had already loaded our luggage and wisked us off to the train station. We were sad to leave. Some people might prefer a more quiet location, we loved watching all the activity.

Reviews.Title: “Nostalgic and retro - a lovely place”
Reviews.Author: halwimsey
Reviews.Content: It's going back a little while, I know, but we stayed here in October 2005 completely by chance. We'd booked a room with a lagoon view at La Perla di Venezia for our last night in Venice, but had arrived to discover that there was a problem with overbooking; after lengthy discussion, the management agreed to find us alternative accommodation with a similar view. The Gabrielli came up trumps (and although our departure from La Perla seems to have been a lucky escape, judging from other TA reviews, to their credit they paid the difference in the room price for us because the Gabrielli was about 50 euros more expensive). We were delighted with the Gabrielli - but then, we like those sorts of grand hotels that have definitely seen better days but still have a touch of dignity although otherwise faded or slightly shabby. This was certainly not that bad! Breakfast was acceptable and plentiful (although the coffee was execrable), and the roof terrace was terrific, even in the Venetian drizzle. Our room was large and bright and had a huge gothic window with a spectacular outlook over the lagoon, as well as a wide ledge on which to sit and sip some wine whilst watching the comings and goings on the Riva below. The bed was comfortable and the chandelier a magnificent example of Murano opulence. We loved the bathroom too, although I can imagine it is not to everyone's taste - probably last renovated some time in the early 1950s, with its black marble walls and green bath and fittings (possibly even 1930s with its Art Deco feel); it was a good size and perfectly clean and serviceable. The shower curtain wasn't quite up to the rest of the room, but we just had a laugh at that! There was also a separate second basin hidden in a cupboard, which came in handy at times. I think what we liked most - apart from the view - was the fact that our room had individuality and character, had not been overly modernised and was not a bland replica of every other new hotel room in Europe. This is a great hotel if you can get a good deal on a room and view over the lagoon. Yes, it is a little dated (probably more three star than four) and a bit further away from the centre of things than you'd think, but if you're the sort of person that doesn't mind these things, you'll find it has plenty of charm and a lot to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Overpriced Hotel - Definately NOT recommended!”
Reviews.Author: SP18
Reviews.Content: Tired run-down hotel and should not have a 4-star rating. The actual rooms look nothing ike the photos on their website. Overpriced and one can definately do better for the rate charged. Although we booked a deluxe room we were shown to a tiny, dark room. After complaining we were offered a better, canal facing room, but had to pay extra. The noise of the boats in the canal kept us awake all night. AWFUL PLACE & no internet service provided. Definately NOT recommended - Dissappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pmb20
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very beautiful. As with many European Hotels (specifically in Venice) which have been converted from Renaissance homes, each room will vary, but I would definitely upgrade to the lagoon room view. The rooms are huge with beautiful new bathrooms, 20 foot ceilings, priceless views and a second half bath. I assume those who wrote poor reviews failed to do their homework and make this request prior to their stay. As I passed a room which was being cleaned along the interior corridor of the hotel, I noticed it was nothing like the lovely room which made our stay so wonderful. Not shabby but small and dark. The staff was courteous, especially the matriach of the family owned establishment who was happy to chat with us. The hotel restaurant was delicious especially the vegetable soup. Don't forget to enjoy some time up in the rooftop solarium, breathtaking views of Venice! There is a private taxi stand, a vaparetto exit and the airport shuttle stop right in front of the hotel. St. Mark's is only a 2 minutes walk along the lagoon and is visible from the lagoon rooms (amazing views). The hotel is a short walk to the Rialto and the Cipriani area and the vaparetto line in front of the hotel goes to Murano. My advice to anyone considering this hotel is not to rely solely on pictures provided on travel websites (they are pictures of the lagoon rooms) when booking an economy room. You book economy, you get economy. You are going on vacation to ITALY and this is not a time to be a penny pincher... spend a few extra bucks to have a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a 4 Star...”
Reviews.Author: pithivier
Reviews.Content: The first room we got looked like a Motel 6 with sparse furniture and 60's drapery, and not like the 4 Star description that hotels.com has it listed for. In addition to this, the towel bar in the bathroom fell each time you tried to access it, and the shower area was so small that the curtain stuck to you as you tried to shower! This room was also unbearably loud being that it was situated on the 1st floor fronting an inner courtyard that you were privy to everyone's conversation! It was also located right next to a main passage way that was a short cut from the guest rooms to the front desk and entrance to the hotel. When we could no longer bear the noise we complained and requested a quieter room. This second room was much quieter, had a large marble bath, two sinks, and not located in a main thoroughfare, and was a bit more spacious. But I would still not rate this hotel as having 4 stars, maybe a 3. The conciege also was not too accomodating, when asked a question, you got the feeling like they were doing you a favor. And in addition to this, you can expect very hard beds with equally hard pillows, but on nice linens, and a very tiny televison that had two Enlgish news channels. All other programming are local Italian stations. Lastly, the hotel is situated much more easterly on the hotels.com map than I had expected. It is apparently in a residential neighborhood. This was good that it offered the hotel a quiet surrounding, but it doesn't not shield you from the noisy guests. I would say caveat emptor (buyer beware) and take your chances if you will. It can be decent bang for the buck depending on the room you are given, but definitely a far cry from some of the other 4 Star hotels you see.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScttLee
Reviews.Content: Good location, a 3 minute walk to San Marco. My single room was larger, though still small, than most Italian single rooms. The bar tender, Guido, was very friendly. Their breakfast was very plain, but their restaurant was very good and reasonably priced. My single room only had a 17" TV suspeded from the wall, the remote was bad. The room was very hot, thermastat did not work, slept with the window opened.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: meliveda
Reviews.Content: Good location, awful hotel! Stay there for three nights and what a great way to make a beautiful city like Venice a disappointment. 70's decoration (pistachio green walls), bathroom falling into pieces, cracks in the walls, a TV around 40 years old! And the best thing is the minibar, a third of the drinks were expired. I can't believe this hotel is rated 4*!

Reviews.Title: “I guess I am use too a better hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price of 330.00 euro's per night that is big noney for a run down hotel on the fringe. Yes it's near transportation we had a water view but the knocking of the boats kept us up almost all night. They were very poor in letting you now where a good place to eat for they never went to one themselves. I guess I am to critical. Sorry

Reviews.Title: “Great location with fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: Rick-in-Hampshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the Hotel. It has a great location close to the waterbus and St Marks Square. The room was a good size for the location although needed decorating, its worth paying the extra cost for the views across the water. The Hotel staff were not very helpful, this seems to be the case throughout Venice. Breakfast at the Hotel is dreadful with stale rolls and burnt croissants! The costs for anything in Venice are very high, so if you intend to stay for sometime be prepared!

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Considering the lack of room in Venice and the fact that most hotels are tiny there, I was surprised to see the room we got here. It was HUGE for a european hotel. It was also very well kept and clean. We did have an issue checking in, but the owner who was on the grounds took care of it for us. I loved it and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sandwirth!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Would definately stay there again. Our only complaint was that we were not there long enough. Our room was beautiful with 2 balconies overlooking the water. It was a very classy hotel. The staff was a little stuffy but helpful and they had a very good breakfast. Janis M Ft. Lauderdale

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Gabrielli Sandwirth
HotelInfo.Address: Riva Degli Schiavoni 4110 | Centre - Castello, 30122 Venice, Italy
